title.value: The generalizability of pre-processing techniques on the accuracy and fairness of data-driven building models: A case study
title.justification: The title is stated clearly at the beginning of the paper and summarizes the focus on the generalizability of pre-processing techniques for data-driven building models.
title.quote: The generalizability of pre-processing techniques on the accuracy and fairness of data-driven building models: A case study

extractions.description: This paper examines the effectiveness of various pre-processing techniques on the performance, specifically focusing on fairness and accuracy, of data-driven models used for predicting building operations such as lighting status. It introduces a new sequentially balanced sampling method and compares it with existing techniques like random sampling and sequential sampling.

type.justification: The study involves empirical experiments and case studies applying pre-processing techniques to evaluate their effect on data-driven building models.
type.quote: In this study, a sequentially balanced sampling (SBS) technique is proposed. Its generalizability to improve fairness and preserve accuracy of DDBMs is compared with four existing pre-processing techniques—random sampling (RS), sequential sampling (SS), reversed preferential sampling (RPS), and sequential preferential sampling (SPS). Totally, 4960 cases are carried out to apply these pre-processing techniques.

name.justification: The main focus of the paper is on improving the accuracy and fairness of data-driven building models using pre-processing techniques.
name.quote: ... development and application of data-driven building models (DDBMs) is a hot research topic.

name.justification: The paper explores different data pre-processing techniques to enhance model performance.
name.quote: Its generalizability to improve fairness and preserve accuracy of DDBMs is compared with four existing pre-processing techniques—random sampling (RS), sequential sampling (SS), reversed preferential sampling (RPS), and sequential preferential sampling (SPS).

name.justification: The DDBMs are the core models used in the research for predicting various building operations.
name.quote: ...development and application of data-driven building models (DDBMs) is a hot research topic.

is_contributed.justification: The paper uses existing data-driven building models to test the pre-processing techniques rather than contributing a new model.
is_contributed.quote: Due to the variation of data volume in different conditions, existing data-driven building models (DDBMs) would present distinct accuracy for different users or periods.

is_executed.justification: The paper involves running simulations or experiments using the DDBMs to evaluate the effect of pre-processing techniques.
is_executed.quote: 4960 cases are carried out to apply these pre-processing techniques to process training dataset before developing 4 types of classifiers for one-week ahead lighting status prediction.

is_compared.justification: The performance of DDBMs is compared before and after applying different pre-processing techniques to assess improvements.
is_compared.quote: Its generalizability to improve fairness and preserve accuracy of DDBMs is compared with four existing pre-processing techniques.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not specify a single reference paper for the data-driven building models it discusses.
referenced_paper_title.quote: development and application of data-driven building models (DDBMs) is a hot research topic.
